intro: Cojoba colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian cojoba, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of Colombia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, humid climates. Cojoba colombiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in local medicine.
